results.title: Line of balance
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Walter Storey
results.brief_description: Line of balance is a programming technique developed by production engineers to plan and control manufacturing processes in factories. Illustrates adaption for use on building sites. Uses animation to explain the basic principles of the techniques, and shows use of the management disciplines of mass production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures and Walter Storey

results.title: Line and Nantha (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Line and Nantha are a couple trying to overcome the restrictive sex-role conditioning they were taught as they were growing up. Nantha talks about his family life in Malaysia and Line describes the everyday sexism of her family in Quebec. They are trying to become a couple and to create a relationship that is egalitarian.

results.title: Line (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Points out that variations in the qualities of lines may be found in nature-lines or rocks, lines on the back of a tiger, and the trail lines made by a snail. Combining photography with animation, illustrates line movement and suggests to children the creative possibilities of materials such as thread, rope and wire as well as paint, chalk and crayon.

results.title: Line
results.creator_credit: Paul Harrison, Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Straight, curved, S-shaped and circular lines are established as being the basis of linear design. Examples in nature stress the need for being aware of line designs in the physical world. There are illustrations of historical use of line in many ways, times, and places. The elements of repetition and rhythm are pointed out in nature, industrial design and architecture

results.title: Linderidge 137
results.creator_credit: New Cinema Workshop and Paul Denby
results.brief_description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.
results.description: Investigates the conventions of storytelling and suspense. The central theme examines the process whereby women in film are represented as the victims of threat and aggression, as the object of the camera’s voyeuristic gaze.

results.title: Linda's film on menstruation
results.creator_credit: Georghe Eichen, Phoenix Films and Linda Feferman
results.brief_description: Humorous film designed to explode the myths surrounding menstruation and inform on the facts. Includes an animated segment explaining the physiological process of menstruation.

results.title: Lincoln County incident
results.brief_description: A satiric western set in the South Island of New Zealand with a cast and crew of over 100 - all children from a New Zealand secondary school. It involves the escapades of diminutive Sampson Peabody-Jones who, in 1881, heads west in search of adventure and a new life. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Limon's legacy
results.creator_credit: Marvin A Lipman, United States Information Agency and George A. Dolney
results.brief_description: Jose Limon who died in 1962 was a major dancer and choreographer from the second generation of modern American dancers, and his works reflected both the tragedy and grandeur of the human spirit. He saw dance as a “vision of ineffable power”. Segments of Limon’s choreography are presented.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marvin A Lipman, United States Information Agency and George A. Dolney

results.title: Limiting the goblin
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
The unidentified submarine intruder known as “the Goblin” is no longer free to trespass at will in Australia’s waters. The “Barra” sonobuoy, the world’s most advanced submarine detection device is now in operation with the Royal Australian Air Force.

results.title: Limelight
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Celebrated Films Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of a washed-up music hall clown who regains confidence while helping a suicidal ballerina. This was Chaplin’s most personal film in turn nostalgic, melancholic and contemplative as he reflects on old age and the nature of art and comedy. There are only moments of humour (notably in tandem with Buster Keaton). Comedy is a tool for Chaplin’s larger enterprise of soul-searching and summing up. Cast also includes Claire Bloom and Nigel Bruce.
